Let's Talk

The Q and A of Medicine Attack Germs

(Game Application)
Software
Language

About

This game was developed from 2023 to 2024. In the game, the child needs to take medicine to get better. To defeat the germs, the player must answer the questions correctly.

Model

(Character)
Sword medicine
(Main Character)

To kill germs and heal the child

Josh
(NPC kid Character)

A sick child needs medicine to get well.

Mother
(NPC Mother Character)

Josh's mother brought medicine for Josh to get better.

Easy Germ
(Enemy Easy Villain Character)
Meduim Germ
(Enemy Meduim Villain Character)
Hard Germ
(Enemy Hard Villain Character)

Place

House
(Intro)

Each level of this game has an intro before the game.

Easy
(Easy Level Game)
Games Rules

Essay scores range from 1 to 20. Score 12 or below and you fail — but get 13 or higher, and you win, unlocking the next stage: the Medium level game!

Complete
  • 19 to 20 = 5 Star
  • 16 to 18 = 4 Star
  • 13 to 15 = 3 Star
Failed
  • 7 to 12 = 2 Star
  • 1 to 6 = 1 Star
  • 0 = 0 Star
Meduim
(Meduim Level Game)
Games Rules

Medium scores range from 1 to 30. Score 15 or below and you fail — but get 16 or higher, and you win, unlocking the next stage: the Hard level game or Final game!

Complete
  • 28 to 30 = 5 Star
  • 22 to 27 = 4 Star
  • 16 to 21 = 3 Star
Failed
  • 10 to 15 = 2 Star
  • 1 to 9 = 1 Star
  • 0 = 0 Star
Hard
(Hard Level Game)
Games Rules

Hard scores range from 1 to 50. Score 25 or below and you fail — but get 26 or higher, and you win!

Complete
  • 45 to 50 = 5 Star
  • 35 to 44 = 4 Star
  • 26 to 34 = 3 Star
Failed
  • 15 to 25 = 2 Star
  • 1 to 14 = 1 Star
  • 0 = 0 Star

Game Demo (User Manual)

Student User
Start Play

Users who access a game from the "Play Games" section first see the game's title screen. To exit, they can click the "X" button, which returns them to the "Start Games" section. To play, users must click "Play Games," log in through the prompted form, and then they can begin gameplay.

Login Form

Clicking the "X" button on the "Student Login" form will return you to the "Start Play" scene. The form includes two textboxes: one for the student's name and one for the section. Upon entering your name and section, the system will validate the information and display a message if there is an incorrect student name, section, or no connection.

Home Page Form

This is the homepage. Clicking the "X" button will log you out and return you to the "Login" scene. The student's name and section of the logged-in user are displayed. There are three buttons: "Play Games," "Settings," and "Review."

Selected level Form

This is the "Play Games" or selected level screen. Clicking the "X" button returns you to the "Homepage." It displays the student's name, section, scores, and passing scores for easy, medium, and hard levels. Buttons for "Easy," "Medium," and "Hard" are present, with "Medium" and "Hard" initially disabled. To unlock "Medium," you need a score of 13 or higher on "Easy," and for "Hard," a score of 16 or higher on "Medium" is required. The total score from all levels must be 55 or higher to pass.

Easy Rules Form

The rule for the easy level is displayed to inform students of the passing score required for progression to the next level. This ensures clarity for players regarding the score needed for advancement. To begin playing, click the "Start" button. Utilize the "X" button to return to the "Selected Level" scene.

Easy (Introduction)

The introduction to the easy game provides insight into the scenario depicted in the game and explains why it unfolded as it did. This is presented through a video. A "Skip" button is provided, enabling players to jump directly into the gameplay if they prefer or if they become eager to begin.

Easy Game

In this easy game, you play as Medicine, and your opponents are Germs. Your objective is to defeat the Germs to help the sick child recover and get out of bed.

Easy Game Wrong Answer

In the easy-level quiz game, players must answer questions correctly to defeat the germs. Each question comes with four answer options.


If a player selects the correct answer, a green circle appears, and an explanation is provided to reinforce why the answer is right.

Easy Game Correct Answer

If a player selects the wrong answer, a red circle appears, and an explanation is given to help the player understand the mistake and learn the correct information.

Easy Failed Result

The result of easy games after answering the quiz game, and here is the defeat result, so it will show a video on how to defeat the character, and then it will show the score and star. When it comes to stars, 0 to 2 stars mean you lose or failed.

Easy Passed Result

This is the result of the easy game after answering the quiz game; this is the result of winning, so this video will show how the character kills the germs and can show the score and star. When it comes to stars, 3 to 5 stars mean you win or passed.

Meduim Rules Form

In the medium level, the rule is displayed showing the passing score needed to unlock the next level. Students click the "Start" button to play. Click the "X" button to return to the "Selected Level" scene.

Meduim (Introduction)

The introduction to the medium-level game sets the stage by depicting the scenario and explaining its origins through a video. A "Skip" button is provided, allowing players to bypass the video if they prefer or are eager to begin playing.

Meduim Game

In the medium-level game, you take on the role of medicine, combating against formidable opponents represented by germs. Your primary objective revolves around defeating these germs, ensuring the wellness of the afflicted individual. So, the sick child can recover.

Meduim Game Wrong Answer

In the medium-level quiz game, your task is to answer questions correctly to defeat the germs. Each question presents two answer options.


If a player selects the wrong answer, a red circle appears, and an explanation is given to help the player understand the mistake and learn the correct information.

Meduim Failed Result

If a player selects the correct answer, a green circle appears, and an explanation is provided to reinforce why the answer is right.

Meduim Passed Result

If a player selects the correct answer, a green circle appears, and an explanation is provided to reinforce why the answer is right.

Meduim Game Correct Answer

If a player selects the correct answer, a green circle appears, and an explanation is provided to reinforce why the answer is right.

Hard Rules Form

The hard-level rule displays the passing score needed to advance. Students can check the score requirement before starting to avoid guessing. Click "Start" to play, and use the "X" button to return to the level selection scene.

Hard (Introduction)

The introduction to the hard-level game provides context through a video, explaining the scenario and its origins. A "Skip" button is available, allowing players to bypass the video if desired or to immediately start playing.

Hard Game

In the hard-level game, players control a character representing medicine, pitted against germs as opponents. The primary objective is to eliminate the germs, thereby allowing the sick child to recover.

Hard Game Wrong Answer

In the hard-level game, players engage in a quiz format to combat germs. Each question is accompanied by an image and four answer options.


If a player selects the wrong answer, a red circle appears, and feedback is provided to clarify why the answer is incorrect and to guide the player toward the correct understanding.

Hard Game Correct Answer

If a player selects the correct answer, a green circle appears, followed by feedback explaining why the answer is correct, reinforcing the player’s knowledge.

Hard Failed Result

Following completion of the quiz game in the hard level, the defeat result is displayed. This includes a video demonstrating how to overcome the character, followed by the presentation of the score and star rating. Scoring between 0 to 2 stars indicates a loss.

Hard Passed Result

Following success in the quiz game at the hard level, the victory result is displayed. A video showcases how the character eliminates the germs, followed by the presentation of the score and star rating. Achieving between 3 to 5 stars indicates a win.

Game Pause

To pause the game for a break, simply click the designated button on the screen. This action prompts the appearance of the pause form. To resume gameplay, click the "Continue" button. If you wish to exit the game entirely, click the "Home" button to return to the "Selected Level" screen. However, please note that any progress made or answers provided before pausing will not be saved.

Game Setting

In the settings menu, you can adjust the music volume using controls to increase, decrease, or mute the sound. Additionally, there is a "Tutorial" button that directs you to the tutorial scene for further guidance on gameplay. To return to the homepage, simply click the "X" button, which will navigate you back to the homepage scene.

Game Tutorial

Here is a tutorial of the game so that the students know what to do, like what to press the buttons for, who your character and your opponent are, and what kind of game it is, especially the ending of the game and the pause.

Game Review

The review section contains six videos to help students prepare for the quiz by providing essential knowledge. Use the ">" button to proceed to the next video and the "<" button to return to the previous one. Click the "X" button to return to the homepage scene.

Teacher User
Start Play

When users access a game in the "Play Games" section, they first see the game's title screen. They can exit by clicking the "X" button, which returns them to the "Start Games" section. To begin playing, users must click the "Play Games" button, log in via the prompted form, and then they can start the game.

Login Form

In the "Teacher Login" form, users enter the teacher's name, which triggers validation checks. The system verifies the student name, section, and internet connection. If any issue is found—such as incorrect details or no internet—an error message is displayed to notify the user.

HomePage Form

The homepage provides teachers with a central hub for managing their classroom activities and monitoring student progress. It prominently displays the teacher's name for personalized access, alongside essential navigation buttons: "Selected Level" for modifying difficulty or content, "Student Record" for accessing individual student performance data, and "Student Count of Correct and Wrong Answers" for a summary of class-wide performance metrics. Additionally, the "X" button enables easy logout, directing users to the "Log in" scene.

Select Level Form

In the "Selected Level" section, teachers are presented with options to choose the difficulty level for classroom activities. The interface includes an "X" button, enabling easy logout by redirecting users to the "Log in" scene. Additionally, three buttons labeled "Easy," "Medium," and "Hard" allow teachers to select the desired difficulty level tailored to their students' needs and abilities. This straightforward interface streamlines the process of customizing learning experiences to match the proficiency levels of individual students or the class as a whole.

Easy (Add Question and Answer)

In the "Easy Games" section, teachers can input questions and answers using eight designated textboxes. These textboxes allow for the specification of sections, questions, four possible answers, and detailed explanations for both correct and incorrect responses. Once the information is entered, teachers can save their data by clicking the "Save" button, or they can use the "Clear" button to erase the textboxes for any necessary corrections. To review the inputted data, teachers can utilize the "View" button.

Easy (View and Edit Question and Answer)

In the "Easy View" section, teachers can review and edit questions in a table format with columns for number, question, explanation, and correctness. Clicking a question fills the text boxes for editing. Teachers can save changes with the "Save" button, clear inputs with the "Clear" button, or return to the "Easy Games" scene using the "X" button. Buttons are only enabled when the text boxes contain content, ensuring efficient interaction.

Meduim (Add Question and Answer)

In the "Medium Games" section, teachers use six textboxes to input sections, questions, two answer choices, and explanations for correct and incorrect responses. The teacher's name is also displayed. Teachers can save entries with the "Save" button, clear fields with the "Clear" button, and review all inputs by clicking the "View" button.

Meduim (View and Edit Question and Answer)

In the "Medium View" section, teachers can review and edit questions displayed in a table format, featuring numbers, questions, explanations, and correctness indicators. Clicking on a question in the list populates the corresponding details in text boxes for editing, including answers 1 and 2. Teachers can save edits using the "Save" button and clear text boxes with the "Clear" button for corrections. The "X" button allows navigation back to the "Medium Game" scene.

Hard (Add Question and Answer)

In the "Hard Games" section, teachers can create advanced questions using eight textboxes for section, question, four answers, explanations, and an image link. The teacher's name is displayed for personalization. By clicking "Show Image," teachers can display the linked image. They can save inputs with the "Save" button, clear fields with the "Clear" button, and review entries using the "View" button.

Hard (View and Edit Question and Answerr)

In the "Hard View" section, teachers can edit questions from a table by selecting an item, which fills the textboxes with details like answers and an image link. They can save changes with the "Save" button, clear inputs with the "Clear" button, and return to the "Hard Game" scene using the "X" button. Buttons are enabled only when textboxes are populated, ensuring efficient use.

Student Record Level (Leaderboard)

The "Level Record" section provides an overview of records for each difficulty level. Users can access records for "Easy," "Medium," and "Hard" levels by clicking corresponding buttons. Additionally, the "X" button allows for easy logout, redirecting users to the "Log in" scene for authentication. This streamlined interface facilitates efficient navigation and access to level-specific records.

Leaderboard Easy, Meduim, Hard

The leaderboards for each difficulty level—Easy, Medium, and Hard—display student records in a tabular format, featuring names, sections, and scores ranked by performance. This organized presentation aids teachers in efficiently identifying top-performing students within each difficulty level, facilitating effective monitoring of student progress and achievement.

Level Count Form

The "Level Count" section offers a comprehensive overview of student performance across different difficulty levels. Users can access count summaries for "Easy," "Medium," and "Hard" levels by selecting the corresponding buttons. Additionally, the "X" button provides a convenient option for logging out, directing users to the "Log in" scene for authentication. This interface simplifies access to level-specific performance metrics, aiding teachers in tracking student progress effectively.

Question Tally Easy, Meduim, Hard

The performance tracking system consists of two tables for each difficulty level: one displaying incorrect responses and the other showing correct responses. Both tables list questions and student names, enabling teachers to identify correct and incorrect answers easily. A text counter tallies the correct and incorrect responses from both tables, simplifying result analysis. This streamlined approach facilitates efficient tracking of student performance across different difficulty levels.
